com.percussion.design.objectstore
Class PSContentEditor

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSComponent
      com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDataSet
          com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSContentEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSComponent, Serializable, Cloneable
public class PSContentEditor
extends com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDataSet

Implements the PSXContentEditorLocalDef DTD defined in ContentEditorLocalDef.dtd.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

PSContentEditor

public PSContentEditor(String name,
                       long contentType,
                       int workflowId)
Creates a new content editor for the provided name, content type and workflow id. Related content is disabled.

Parameters:
name - the dataSet name, not null or empty.
contentType - the content type this editor will will work with.
workflowId - the workflow id used for items of this content editor.

PSContentEditor

public PSContentEditor(String name,
                       long contentType,
                       int workflowId,
                       boolean enableRelatedContent)
Creates a new content editor for the provided name, content type and workflow id. Related content is enabled as specified.

Parameters:
name - the dataSet name, not null or empty.
contentType - the content type this editor will will work with.
workflowId - the workflow id used for items of this content editor.
enableRelatedContent - this flag defines whether or not related content is supported by this content editor.

PSContentEditor

public PSContentEditor(String name,
                       long contentType,
                       int workflowId,
                       boolean enableRelatedContent,
                       com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSCommandHandlerStylesheets stylesheetSet)
Creates a new content editor for the provided name, content type, workflow id and stylesheet set. Related content is enabled as specified.

Parameters:
name - the dataSet name, not null or empty.
contentType - the content type this editor will will work with.
workflowId - the workflow id used for items of this content editor.
enableRelatedContent - this flag defines whether or not related content is supported by this content editor.
stylesheetSet - the stylesheet set, not null.

PSContentEditor

public PSContentEditor(String name,
                       long contentType,
                       int workflowId,
                       com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSCommandHandlerStylesheets stylesheetSet)
Creates a new content editor for the provided name, content type, workflow id and stylesheet set. Related content is disabled.

Parameters:
name - the dataSet name, not null or empty.
contentType - the content type this editor will will work with.
workflowId - the workflow id used for items of this content editor.
stylesheetSet - the stylesheet set, not null.

public Object clone()
Description copied from interface: IPSComponent
Creates a new instance of this object, deep copying all member variables. If an implementing class has mutable member variables, it must override this method and clone() each of those variables. This method will create a shallow copy if it is not overridden.

NOTE: Currently, this method has been overridden only in a subset of the classes that require it. Only those classes recursively aggregated by PSDisplayMapper are correct.

Specified by:
clone in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:

getObjectType

public int getObjectType()
Before 5.0, there was only 1 type of content, namely item. In 5.0, we introduced a new type, folder. We genericized the editors to work with the concept of different content (or object) types. These types are defined in the OBJECTS table. The type is the primary key of that table.

Returns:
One of the PSCmsObject.TYPE_XXX values. The default value is PSCmsObject.TYPE_ITEM.

setObjectType

public void setObjectType(int type)
See getObjectType() for a full description.

Parameters:
type - Must be one of the OBJECT_TYPE_xxx values.

getWorkflowInfo

public com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSWorkflowInfo getWorkflowInfo()
Returns:
the PSWorkflowInfo object that holds the dynamic workflow rules, or null, and if null it is treated as all workflows allowed by community visibility.

setWorkflowInfo

Parameters:

getCustomActionGroups

public Iterator getCustomActionGroups()
Get all custom action groups currently defined. A custom action can be used by the designer to add and remove default buttons supplied by the system in various locations.

Returns:
the current custom action group, might be null.
See Also:
getCustomActionGroup(int, int, String), PSLocation

getCustomActionGroup

public com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSCustomActionGroup getCustomActionGroup(int pageType,
                                                                                  int pageLocation,
                                                                                  String fieldRef)
Scans all custom actions currently defined and returns a set of them that match the supplied parameters. See PSLocation.hasCustomActions for a description of the params.

Returns:
A valid action that matches the supplied criteria, or null if no match was found.

Parameters:
customActionGroup - an existing custom action group, If null , nothing is done.

fromXml

public void fromXml(Element sourceNode,
                    com.percussion.design.objectstore.IPSDocument parentDoc,
                    ArrayList parentComponents)
             throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
Description copied from interface: IPSComponent
This method is called to populate an object from its XML representation. An element node may contain a hierarchical structure, including child objects. The element node can also be a child of another element node.

Each component should add itself to parentComponents before constructing its child components, and should restore the original parentComponents before returning.

Specified by:
fromXml in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:
fromXml in class com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDataSet
Parameters:
sourceNode - the XML element node to populate from, not null .
parentDoc - may be null.
parentComponents - a collection of all the components created in the process of creating this component. May be null.
Throws:
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if the XML element node does not represent a type supported by the class.

toXml

public Element toXml(Document doc)
Description copied from interface: IPSComponent
This method is called to create an XML element node with the appropriate format for the given object. An element node may contain a hierarchical structure, including child objects. The element node can also be a child of another element node.

Specified by:
toXml in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:

Returns:

validate

public void validate(com.percussion.design.objectstore.IPSValidationContext context)
              throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSValidationException
Validates this object's internal state by checking that:
  1. Content type is a valid id
  2. Workflow is a valid id
  3. A PSContentEditorPipe is attached
  4. Each child node is valid

Specified by:
validate in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:
validate in class com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDataSet
Parameters:
context - The validation context, not null.
Throws:
PSValidationException - if a validation error or warning occurs.

getViewSet

public com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSViewSet getViewSet()
Gets this content editor's view set. Used to filter the fields that are displayed.

Returns:
The view set, may be null if one has not been set by a call to setViewSet(PSViewSet).

setViewSet

public void setViewSet(com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSViewSet viewSet)
Sets a view set on this editor. See getViewSet() for more info.

Parameters:
viewSet - The viewSet, may not be null.

getIconSource

public String getIconSource()
Gets the source of the icon for this content editor one of ICON_SOURCE_XXX value. Defaulted to ICON_SOURCE_NONE, never null.

getIconValue

public String getIconValue()
Gets the icon value. If the getIconSource() is none then the value will be null. The value depends on the mode. See ICON_SOURCE_XXX for the details.

setContentTypeIcon

public void setContentTypeIcon(String source,
                               String value)
Sets the icon source and values.

Parameters:
source - Must be one of ICON_SOURCE_XXX values.
value - Must not be blank if icon source is not ICON_SOURCE_NONE.

setIconSource

public void setIconSource(String source)
Sets the icon source.

Parameters:
source - the new icon source, it must be one of ICON_SOURCE_XXX values.

setIconValue

public void setIconValue(String iconValue)
Sets icon value.

Parameters:
iconValue - the new icon value. It may be null or empty if the icon source is ICON_SOURCE_NONE.
